Operation 'query_query_post' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, unclear_purpose, missing_output_details, not_actionable, poor_ai_interpretability. Original summary 'Query' is too generic and not action-oriented. Description contains procedural guidance mixed with unclear phrasing ('don't do this often'). Improved version: (1) clarifies the operation executes document retrieval queries, (2) specifies input structure (query + optional filters), (3) explains output (ranked chunks with scores), (4) provides clear guidance on query decomposition and error handling, (5) uses consistent domain terminology (document chunks, relevance scores, metadata filters), (6) helps AI agents understand when to use this operation and how to structure requests for optimal results.

data.current_description: Accepts search query objects array each with query and optional filter. Break down complex questions into sub-questions. Refine results by criteria, e.g. time / source, don't do this often. Split queries if ResponseTooLargeError occurs.
data.summary_suggestion: Execute document retrieval queries with optional filtering
data.description_suggestion: Executes one or more document retrieval queries against the indexed document collection. Each query object contains a natural language search query and optional metadata filters (e.g., source, date range). Returns ranked document chunks matching the queries with relevance scores. For complex questions, submit multiple focused sub-queries rather than a single broad query. If a ResponseTooLargeError occurs, split the query into smaller, more specific queries. Metadata filtering should be used judiciously to refine results when needed.

Improved version: (1) provides action-oriented summary, (2) clearly explains the operation's purpose and what it does, (3) specifies input structure (query objects with optional filters), (4) describes output (ranked document chunks with scores), (5) clarifies when to use query decomposition and splitting, (6) mentions authentication requirement, (7) uses consistent domain terminology (document chunks, metadata filters, relevance scores) aligned with the API's retrieval context.

data.current_description: Accepts search query objects array each with query and optional filter. Break down complex questions into sub-questions. Refine results by criteria, e.g. time / source, don't do this often. Split queries if ResponseTooLargeError occurs.
data.summary_suggestion: Execute document retrieval queries with optional filtering
data.description_suggestion: Executes one or more document retrieval queries against the indexed document collection. Each query object contains a natural language search query and optional metadata filters (e.g., source, date range). Returns ranked document chunks matching the queries with relevance scores. Supports query decomposition for complex questions and result filtering by metadata criteria. If a single query returns too many results (ResponseTooLargeError), split into multiple smaller queries. Requires HTTP Bearer authentication.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Query' is too generic and not action-oriented.
